eph package¶

eph package aims to provide useful classes, functions and tools to represent, retrieve and manipulate ephemerides.

  • eph.eph module contains the definition of Eph class, the base class for representing an ephemeris. Eph class inherits from the astropy Table class (see astropy.table for documentation).
  • eph.jpl module contains utility classes needed to retrieve and parse Jpl Horizons ephemerides.
  • eph.util module contains project wide utility functions.

Submodules¶

eph.eph module¶

eph module define Eph class, the base class representing an ephemeris.

class eph.eph.Eph(data=None, masked=None, names=None, dtype=None, meta=None, copy=True, rows=None, copy_indices=True, **kwargs)¶

Bases: astropy.table.table.Table

Base class representing an ephemeris object. An Eph object is an astropy Table (see astropy.table for documentation).

eph.jpl module¶

jpl module contains classes and functions useful to interact with the Jpl Horizons service from NASA.

eph.jpl.codify(name, ref=False)¶

Translates a human readable celestial object’s name to jpl code.

Parameters:
  • name (str) – the name to be translated.
  • ref (boolean) – whether the code has to be a reference frame code.
Returns:

the jpl code.
Return type:

str.
eph.jpl.humanify(code)¶

Translates a jpl code to a human readable celestial object’s name.

Parameters:code (str) – the code to be translated.
Returns:the name of the celestial object.
Return type:str.
